abstract: Saudi Arabia is lashing out against its rival Iran as United States and Iranian negotiators near agreement over Iran's nuclear program; Saudi Arabia is leading airstrikes against Iranian-backed faction in Yemen, supporting jihadists in Syria against Iranian-backed regime of Pres Bashar al-Assad, and planning other regional moves to reduce Iranian influence; moves come in wake of King Salman's ascension to throne.
lead_paragraph: The talks themselves are already changing the dynamics of regional politics as Saudi Arabia, Iran’s chief regional rival, acts against Iranian-backed groups in Yemen, Syria and Iraq.

headline.main: As U.S. and Iran Seek Nuclear Deal, Saudi Arabia Makes Its Own Moves
headline.print_headline: Saudis Make Own Moves as U.S. and Iran Talk

snippet: The talks themselves are already changing the dynamics of regional politics as Saudi Arabia, Iran’s chief regional rival, acts against Iranian-backed groups in Yemen, Syria and Iraq.
